column5: Jane is running for city council and I am trying to support her. This is a difficult neighborhood to rally so I want to draw the community together.
column7:
1. Jane, what inspired you to run for city council? (This question can help Jane share her personal motivations and values, allowing you to better understand her perspective and connect on a deeper level.)

2. Jane, can you tell me about a moment that really shaped your views on community involvement and local politics? (This question can prompt Jane to share a personal story that highlights her passion and commitment to serving the community, fostering a sense of trust and camaraderie between the two of you.)

3. Jane, what do you believe are the biggest challenges facing our neighborhood, and how do you plan to address them if elected? (This question can serve as a way to discuss important issues facing the community, inviting a conversation about potential solutions and strategies for improvement, while also showing your support and interest in Jane's platform.)

column3: We met at a pickleball conference
column4: His sister dated my best friend
column6: I just got a promotion as a sales director
column8:
1. "Rob, when we first met at that pickleball conference, we were surrounded by enthusiasts and novices alike. Now that you're transitioning into retirement, have you considered dedicating more time towards this fascinating sport? Maybe use your skills to tutor the younger generation, thereby passing the baton and giving back to the community?"

2. "From being a pickleball enthusiast to now stepping into this new phase of life, retirement, how are you feeling? As someone who just stepped into a role of greater responsibility with my promotion, I understand transitions can be empowering yet challenging. Can you share your emotional journey during this major life shift?"

3. "Our connection goes back to the good old days when your sister dated my best friend. As you retire, I'm sure it's a time to reflect and possibly renew old connections. How has your perception to these relationships evolved over the years? In my new role as a sales director, I've been realizing the importance of maintaining strong relationships."
